articles.author: Do Gyun Kim, Jimin Jung
articles.description: Protesters gathered in the capital of South Korea on Saturday to demand that the government take steps to avoid what they fear is a looming disaster from Japan's release of treated radioactive water from the Fukushima nuclear power plant.
articles.title: South Korean protesters call for government action on Fukushima water

articles.author: Rachel Nostrant
articles.description: Thousands of Americans will converge on Washington on Saturday to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the March on Washington, a pivotal event in the 1960s U.S. civil rights movement at which Martin Luther King Jr gave his galvanizing "I have a dream" speech.
articles.title: Sixty years after King's 'dream' speech, thousands gather in Washington

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Kenya's transport minister apologised to the country late on Friday night after a widespread electricity blackout left passengers at the main airport in Nairobi grappling in darkness.
articles.title: Kenyan minister apologises after main airport loses power in blackout

articles.author: Nelson Banya, Nyasha Chingono
articles.description: Partial results from Zimbabwe's parliamentary election suggested the ruling party's lead was growing on Friday, but election observers said the vote did not meet international standards and was conducted in a "climate of fear".
articles.title: Zimbabwe ruling party's vote lead grows as observers decry 'climate of fear'

articles.author: Gerauds Wilfried Obangome
articles.description: Gabonese voters head to the polls on Saturday for presidential, legislative, and local elections that the opposition hopes will foil President Ali Bongo's bid for a third term and end his family's 56-year grip on power.
articles.title: Gabon to vote as president Bongo seeks to extend 56-year family dynasty

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sudan's military ruler visited army bases near Khartoum on his first trip away from the capital since an internal conflict broke out in April, as the United Nations warned that the war could tip the entire region into a humanitarian catastrophe.
articles.title: Sudan's military ruler Burhan begins tour as UN warns of war spreading

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of Japan's Komeito party, the junior partner in the coalition government, will postpone his planned visit to China at China's request, the party announced on Saturday.
articles.title: Head of Japan coalition partner postpones China visit at China's request

articles.author: Gram Slattery, Nathan Layne, Blake Brittain
articles.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump's historic mug shot, posted by a Georgia courthouse on Thursday evening, is being turned into T-shirts, shot glasses, mugs, posters and even bobblehead dolls by friends and foes alike.
articles.title: Divided US embraces Trump mug-shot merchandise

articles.author: Andrew Osborn
articles.description: President Vladimir Putin has ordered Wagner fighters to sign an oath of allegiance to the Russian state after a deadly plane crash believed to have killed Yevgeny Prigozhin, the volatile chief of the mercenary group.
articles.title: Putin orders Wagner fighters to sign oath of allegiance after Prigozhin's demise

articles.author: Lauren Silva Laughlin
articles.description: Tupperware Brands (TUP.N) is struggling to stop the rot. The iconic maker of food-storage containers, one of the first companies to capitalize on viral buzz – often sparked by housewives, as they were known in the 1950s –has narrowly avoided going bust. As much as technology has remade business strategies over the past 77 years, Facebook owner Meta Platforms (META.O) leans on a comparable one. It’s a fresh example of how influencers can also be spoilers.
articles.title: Tupperware preserves lessons for Mark Zuckerberg
